books.description: To break away from a Covid-19 stricken New York City, a food delivery driver takes a job to help save a group of endangered animals living on another planet. Read by Wil Wheaton. 8 hours, 2 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE KAIJU PRESERVATION SOCIETY

books.author: Laura Dave
books.description: Hannah Hall discovers truths about her missing husband. Read by Rebecca Lowman. 8 hours, 49 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE LAST THING HE TOLD ME

books.author: Will Smith with Mark Manson
books.contributor: by Will Smith with Mark Manson
books.description: The actor, producer and musician tells his life story and lessons he learned along the way. Read by Will Smith. 16 hours, 16 minutes unabridged.
books.title: WILL

books.author: Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over the last 35 years. Read by the author. 6 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery. Read by Sean Pratt. 16 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: Dave Grohl
books.description: A memoir by the musician known for his work with Foo Fighters and Nirvana. Read by the author. 10 hours, 35 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE STORYTELLER

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.description: Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: William P. Barr
books.description: The former attorney general for George H.W. Bush and Donald Trump gives his account of those two tenures. Read by Mark Deakins. 22 hours, 2 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ONE DAMN THING AFTER ANOTHER

books.author: Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
books.contributor: by Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
books.description: An approach to dealing with trauma that shifts an essential question used to investigate it. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 27 minutes unabridged.
books.title: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?

books.author: edited  Nikole Hannah-Jones, Caitlin Roper, Ilena Silverman and Jake Silverstein
books.contributor: edited by Nikole Hannah-Jones, Caitlin Roper, Ilena Silverman and Jake Silverstein
books.contributor_note: edited by Nikole Hannah-Jones, Caitlin Roper, Ilena Silverman and Jake Silverstein
books.description: America’s entanglement with slavery and its legacy is told through expanded essays first published in The New York Times Magazine. Read by Nikole Hannah-Jones and a full cast. 18 hours, 57 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE 1619 PROJECT

books.author: Bob Odenkirk
books.description: The actor and writer, known for his work in sketch comedy and dramatic roles, charts his path. Read by Steve Rudnick, Leo Benvenuti and the author. 7 hours, 52 minutes unabridged.
books.title: COMEDY COMEDY COMEDY DRAMA

books.author: Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.” Read by the author. 8 hours, 50 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BORN A CRIME

books.author: Glenn Beck with Justin Haskins
books.contributor: by Glenn Beck with Justin Haskins
books.description: The syndicated radio host portrays what he sees as a conspiracy to shift economic and social power. Read by Glenn Beck. 9 hours, 57 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE GREAT RESET

books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species. Read by Derek Perkins. 15 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SAPIENS

books.author: Elie Mystal
books.description: The Nation’s legal analyst and justice correspondent posits ways to protect the rights of women and people of color. Read by the author. 8 hours, 37 minutes unabridged.
books.title: ALLOW ME TO RETORT

books.author: Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice. Read by the author. 8 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: UNTAMED

books.author: Adam Grant
books.description: An examination of the cognitive skills of rethinking and unlearning that could be used to adapt to a rapidly changing world. Read by the author. 6 hours, 40 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THINK AGAIN

books.author: Ray Dalio
books.title: PRINCIPLES FOR DEALING WITH THE CHANGING WORLD ORDER

books.description: Stories within a story come to life as Li'l Petey, Flippy and Molly show baby frogs how to create comics.

books.description: The F.B.I. agent Atlee Pine’s search for her twin sister overlaps with a military investigator’s hunt for someone involved in a global conspiracy.

books.description: Two estranged sisters, one a former best-selling author, the other a nun, reconnect as one searches for the child the other gave up.

books.description: A gown that always ends up in a wedding ceremony impacts two women.

books.description: Two romance stories: “Night Shift” and “Night Shadow.”
